dta.VirtualLink¶

class dta.VirtualLink(id, startNode, endNode, label)¶

Bases: dta.Link.Link

A VirtualLink is a Link that connects a Centroid with a Connector.

__init__(id, startNode, endNode, label)¶

Constructor. Verifies one node is a Centroid and the other node is a VirtualNode.

  • id is a unique identifier (unique within the containing network), an integer
  • startNode, endNode are Node instances
  • label is a string, or None

Methods

__init__ x.__init__(...) initializes x; see help(type(x)) for signature
VirtualLink.euclideanLength
euclideanLength()¶

Calculates the length based on simple Euclidean distance.

getAdjacentConnector()¶

A VirtualLink connects a Centroid with a Connector; this returns the Connector instance.

getEndNode()¶

Accessor for endNode

getId()¶

Return the link id

getOtherEnd(node)¶

Return the other end node than the one provided.

getReferenceAngle()¶

Visualizing the link as a straight vector from (0,0), returns the angle between <1,0> and this link.

So returns a number in [0,2pi), increasing clockwise.

These are based on the euclidean length of the link, so assumes a straight line. If the link has no length, returns 0.

getStartNode()¶

Accessor for startNode

isConnector()¶

Return True if this Link is a Connector

isRoadLink()¶

Return True this Link is RoadLink

isVirtualLink()¶

Return True if this LInk is a VirtualLink
